message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to be discussing the sale of this product with you.  I believe its true value is significant and will greatly benefit you. To start the conversation, I propose an initial price of $2,000,000.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $1,500,000. I believe that's a fair price considering the market value.

Bob, I appreciate your interest and counteroffer. While I understand your perspective on the value,  I believe my initial price is closer to reflecting the product's true worth and long-term potential.  To move us closer to a deal, I'm willing to come down to $1,850,000.

I appreciate your willingness to come down to $1,850,000, but I'm still a bit concerned about the price. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, so I'm offering $1,725,000. I believe this is a fair price for the product, considering its value and my budget.

Bob, I see we are getting closer. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. In the spirit of compromise, I can offer the product for $1,775,000. I believe this price reflects the value it brings while acknowledging your budget considerations.

I appreciate your continued willingness to negotiate, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to go down to $1,700,000, which is the lowest I'm willing to go. I believe this is a fair price for the product, considering its value and my budget.
